page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: The only public transport in the area is provided by the National Red and White buses. Their services X73, 31 and 38 go through hourly. The X73 goes along the A48 to Newport and Cardiff. The 31 goes along the A48 to Cinderford and Coleford in the Forest of Dean. The 38 goes along the A40 to Hereford. In the other direction all the buses go to Gloucester. There are some works buses which pick people up to take them to work. Although we have a railway line passing through, there is no station nearer than Gloucester. The lack of public transport means that most people have to rely on cars.
